FlowGraph
Table of Contents

Class EdgeDefinition

Namespace
FlowGraph.Core.Models
Assembly
FlowGraph.Core.dll

Immutable definition of an edge's identity and connection structure. Contains all properties that define "what" an edge connects, not its runtime state.

public sealed record EdgeDefinition : IEquatable<EdgeDefinition>
Inheritance
object
EdgeDefinition
Implements
IEquatable<EdgeDefinition>
Inherited Members
object.Equals(object)
object.Equals(object, object)
object.GetHashCode()
object.GetType()
object.ReferenceEquals(object, object)
object.ToString()

Remarks

This is a sealed record for value equality and immutability. Use with expressions to create modified copies:

var reconnected = definition with { Target = "newNodeId" };

Properties

AutoRoute

Whether this edge should use automatic routing to avoid obstacles.

public bool AutoRoute { get; init; }

Property Value

bool

Remarks

This property is maintained for backward compatibility. For new code, prefer using RoutingMode instead. When RoutingMode is explicitly set, it takes precedence.

EffectiveLabel

Gets the effective label text, preferring LabelInfo over Label.

public string? EffectiveLabel { get; }

Property Value

string

EffectiveRoutingMode

Gets the effective routing mode, considering both RoutingMode and legacy AutoRoute property.

public EdgeRoutingMode EffectiveRoutingMode { get; }

Property Value

EdgeRoutingMode

Remarks

If AutoRoute is true and RoutingMode is Auto, obstacle avoidance is enabled. Otherwise, RoutingMode determines behavior.

Id

Unique identifier for the edge. Required and immutable.

public required string Id { get; init; }

Property Value

string

Label

Optional label to display on the edge.

public string? Label { get; init; }

Property Value

string

Remarks

For simple labels, use this property directly. For advanced positioning control, use LabelInfo instead. If both are set, LabelInfo takes precedence.

LabelInfo

Enhanced label with positioning information.

public LabelInfo? LabelInfo { get; init; }

Property Value

LabelInfo

Remarks

When set, this takes precedence over Label. Use EffectiveLabel to get the resolved label text regardless of which property was set.

MarkerEnd

The marker to display at the end of the edge.

public EdgeMarker MarkerEnd { get; init; }

Property Value

EdgeMarker

MarkerStart

The marker to display at the start of the edge.

public EdgeMarker MarkerStart { get; init; }

Property Value

EdgeMarker

RoutingMode

Determines how this edge's path is calculated.

public EdgeRoutingMode RoutingMode { get; init; }

Property Value

EdgeRoutingMode

Remarks

  • Auto - Router fully controls path (default)
  • Manual - Uses only user-defined waypoints
  • Guided - Router path passes through user waypoints

Source

The ID of the source node.

public required string Source { get; init; }

Property Value

string

SourcePort

The ID of the source port on the source node.

public required string SourcePort { get; init; }

Property Value

string

Target

The ID of the target node.

public required string Target { get; init; }

Property Value

string

TargetPort

The ID of the target port on the target node.

public required string TargetPort { get; init; }

Property Value

string

Type

The visual type of the edge (bezier, straight, step, etc.).

public EdgeType Type { get; init; }

Property Value

EdgeType

Creates a new definition with enhanced label positioning.

public EdgeDefinition WithLabelInfo(string text, LabelAnchor anchor = LabelAnchor.Center, double offsetX = 0, double offsetY = 0)

Parameters

text string

The label text.

anchor LabelAnchor

Where along the edge to position the label.
